Journal

This virtual journal is a space for reflection, learning, and documenting how I think through design and creative work. Entries here aren’t optimized for likes, comments, or sharing — they’re simply notes I find useful to capture and share over time.

  • Type — Indicates how I'm thinking in this entry.
    • Reflection: Interpreting experience and articulating prespective
    • Learning: Exploring new ideas, frameworks, or skills in progress
    • Process: Documenting how work moves from problem to outcome
  • Status — Signals how complete or settled the idea is.
    • Ongoing:Actively evolving thinking
    • Snapshot: A point-in-time prespective
    • Retrospective: Reflection after completion or distance
  • Context — Shows where the thinking originates.
    • Product Design: Practice, systems, and decisions-making in product work
    • Game UI: Interface design and interaction thinking for games
    • Career: Growth, leadership, and professional development
Reflection

Why Designers Must Learn to Articulate Their Decisions

A reflection on why strong design fails without clear articulation—and how communication protects scope, confidence, and intent.

  • Product Design
  • Ongoing
Reflection

Understanding Stakeholder Perspectives

A reflective exploration of how understanding stakeholder perspectives enables clearer design communication, stronger alignment, and more effective decision-making across cross-functional teams.

  • Product Design
  • Snapshot
Reflection

Using AI as a Productivity Partner

A reflective snapshot on using AI as a productivity partner across the product design lifecycle—enhancing clarity, efficiency, and focus without replacing core UX thinking or judgment.

  • Product Design
  • Snapshot
